TopicTitle: Fresh pair of eyes - I need a new architecture challenge

Articles.Content:
I thought I'd reach out to the KSP community to ask for suggestions on what challenge to do next. Having spent a good few evenings trawling though the challenge section of the forum I have failed to find anything that fits the Billy-Bob Kerman for me.

I'm mostly into leviathan architecture style challenges requiring quite a lot of applied thinking and engineering skills to pull off. I've previously completed some big challenges, links to them can be found in my signature, which should give you an idea of the sort of scale I'm thinking.

If anyone has any suggestions they would be gratefully received.

If you really feel like it you can create an entirely new challenge for me, or even give me the bones of a large scale challenge that you haven't got the time or energy to develop, that I might be able to develop and eventually post to the challenge section (with credit)

Thanks everyone - looking forward to seeing the suggestions!

SM

1. Build a Cathedral

2. Put it on the Mun
^That's so ridiculously misusing the word architecture in the context of this post that I might actually try it^
After going through the awesome mission reports in your signature I can now tell that I used the wrong definition.
Put a flying base in jool's atmosphere, 4 having plane landing on, some of marvel flying base, but ,on jool's atmo !!

After going through the awesome mission reports in your signature I can now tell that I used the wrong definition.

All the same:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

FacialJack: I have toyed with that idea before, I think I need a few more mods to make that one come to life - got me thinking though.

Keep those ideas rolling!
IT'S BEAUTIFUL!

Build a really fast rover.... that has no wheels.

(Its a really fun challenge!)
I use Hooligan parts, which have ballon parts inside, very usefull, even for having less weight in ship, and use less fuel 4 landing on planet wiz atmo

You should do a mission where you visit every Easter egg with one ship. If a planet doesn't have an easter egg, don't go to it (no Moho, Eeloo, Laythe, Pol, Dres, Ike, Gilly, Eve). Just an idea

Or, another one i've seen is The Constellation Challenge

Edited August 4, 2014 by Mr.Rocket

Hmmm, maybe something like this?

Rather than just maxing the tech tree, can you strip the Kerbol system of science in as few launches as possible?

Did you see my Joolian Holidays Challenge?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86097-Joolian-Holidays-Challenge

No worries if you're not interested, but it needs developement if you would prefer to help with that

What about a no-refuel, no-docking, no landers grand tour?

(You must land the entire ship)

Build a Mass Effect Relay and place it on the edge of the system.

Bonus points for using a ship to carry it there that looks like it could fit in the Mass Effect universe

What about building the saturn V memorial on the mun?

I mean not apollo-11 lm memorial, but putting a whole saturn v on the mun.

I started building a baseball stadium on Duna. The outfield bleachers were eerily reminiscent of the roof of your cathedral above (nice work, that!)

Where I died of boredom was using rovers armed with i-beams for the foul lines. Needed SO MANY of them!!!

Maybe I overlooked a way to drop most of it down in one piece?

(Substitute your favorite sport...)

1. Build a Cathedral

2. Put it on the Mun

Well ... not on the moon, but I had a similar idea.

I had no problems with Lithobraking at a velocity of 50m/s ;-)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

(The Cathedral alone has 272 parts & ~72ton)

What about a no-refuel, no-docking, no landers grand tour?

(You must land the entire ship)

This. Or at least a multi-body mission in general. Since you've done Jool 5s, maybe a "Minus Jool 5" where you go everywhere *but* the Joolian moons.

So you like large builds...mmm... Have you tried a collonizing tour. 1 launch with enough smaller craft attached to fit out a complete outpost or 2 and do it for somwhewre hard like Tylo with an easy side version for maybe Bob or Pol.

With extra brownie points for extra outposts

Include Outpost habitate, rover and return craft and remember the hard part is the single launch

Try out the Test Pilot Challenge. It is a scene setup by hoster for you to complete series of mission. You don't have any design task. Just follow the flag plate reading and perform the mission. Finished it as soon as possible.

Wow, great to see so much discussion, it's really helping me narrow in on what I want to do next. In response to (hopefully) all of you so far:

Cantab Ã¢â‚¬â€œ IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m in favour of a multi body mission, and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m certainly not impartial to revisiting the Jool system. I think it makes for seriously challenging and very pretty pictures. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d prefer a multiple launch challenge to a single ship challenge.

KandoKris Ã¢â‚¬â€œ As part of my Jool 5 Kethane challenge I colonised every moon apart from Tylo with a rover, hopper, and orbital scanner. I also left a space station, kethane miner, descent and ascent vehicle, and main engine decks in orbit around Jool. I tried it as a single launch but it was waaaay to wibblywobbly and my laptop really struggled, hence my preference for multiple launches using a common vehicle.

@ Speeding Mullet : Here, try this out. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/52141-KSP-Test-Pilot-Challenge

It works in 0.22, but not tested on 0.24.2.

Xactar Ã¢â‚¬â€œ IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m not quite sure what you mean Ã¢â‚¬â€œ surely a rover with no wheels is going to be a nightmare, but also an aeroplane?

Ok, you may have a point with the nightmare bit. XD You can see an example of what I mean in the video link in my sig. Spinrovers are a lot of fun and a neat challenge.
Speeding mullet, try making a Republic cheesecake Cruiser that is stable and can fly.

Xactar that's agreat vid lol. May give that one a go when I get home!

Sirine thanks I had a look is not for me as I get so much enjoyment out of engineering my own stuff.

ThinkOutsideTheHangar Thanks but building replicas isn't really for me. I like drawing inspiration from Scifi when I can though.

I'm going to look at the Joolian Holidays Challenge as it will tie my experience with jool5s as well as Sturmstigers Duna challenge together.

Thanks for the help everyone feel free to suggest more things If you like but I'm now with direction so you guys came up trumps.
